channel.title: Posts on Anna Kurtin
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Anna Kurtin

item.title: How I Got Into Coding
item.description: Ah, coding. Love it or hate it, it’s an essential tool in many biologists’ repertoire. Going into college, I had no idea that there would be so much coding and computer work involved. In fact, if you had shown freshman year me one of my latest projects, I would have run in the other direction! This pretty sums up how I got into coding. Credit: unknown Throughout high school, I was infamous among my family and friends for being hopelessly lost when working with computers.

item.title: Kinkajou Travels (Costa Rica Internship Blog)
item.description: In the fall semester of my junior year, I took part in an internship abroad with Kids Saving the Rainforest, a wildlife rescue, sanctuary, and conservation center in Quepos, Costa Rica. This fantastic study abroad experience taught me more than I could have imagined about conservation, animal care, Costa Rican history and culture, research, ecotourism and more. I maintained a blog documenting my experiences there, and while it is by no means comprehensive, it gives a good account of my time in Costa Rica.
